nodes.bodyText:
Please note that these values have to align, i.e. belong together:
The API key has to authenticate the project, identified by the Project ID.
The Application ID has to identify an application that belongs to the same project.
If the remote parameters do not match like this, requests will fail in the background,.
These are valid. I checked against Firebase servers and Google Cloud frontend.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -43,6 +44,10 @@
 
 class PushRegistratorFCM extends PushRegistratorAbstractGoogle {
 
+   private static final String FCM_DEFAULT_PROJECT_ID = "onesignal-shared-public"; // project_info.project_id
+   private static final String FCM_DEFAULT_APP_ID = "1:754795614042:android:c682b8144a8dd52bc1ad63"; // client.client_info.mobilesdk_app_id
+   private static final String FCM_DEFAULT_API_KEY = "AIzaSyAnTLn5-_4Mc2a2P-dKUeE-aBtgyCrjlYU"; // client.api_key.current_key
+

nodes.bodyText:
Are these hardcoded constant values of OneSignal default keys in Firebase panel?
@jkasten2
